results.title: How a Genetic Trait in Black People Can Give the Police Cover
results.abstract: Sickle cell trait has been cited in dozens of police custody deaths ruled accidental or natural, even though the condition is benign on its own, a Times investigation found.
results.byline: By Michael LaForgia and Jennifer Valentino-DeVries

results.title: Why the C.D.C. Changed Its Advice on Masks
results.abstract: Two scientific findings altered the calculus: Vaccinated people don’t transmit the virus, and the shots are effective against variants.

results.title: Ladran, gruñen y no son amigables pero, según los científicos, esos perros aprenden mejor
results.abstract: A los perros que no serían la primera opción de muchos dueños de mascotas les va mejor cuando tienen que aprender de un extraño, en comparación con algunos canes más agradables.

multimedia.caption: Investigadores en Hungría definieron los comportamientos de un grupo de perros que estaban estudiando como “gruñones”, porque “estos perros no son exactamente agresivos pero tienen esa actitud gruñona”

results.title: Vaccinated Americans May Go Without Masks in Most Places, Federal Officials Say
results.abstract: Fully vaccinated people do not have to wear masks or maintain social distance indoors or outdoors, with some exceptions, the C.D.C. advised.

results.title: William R. Harris Dies at 79; Hoped to Curb Risks of Nuclear War
results.abstract: A lawyer and policy analyst, he studied ways to forestall energy crises and other catastrophes. He died of Covid-19.
des_facet: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

multimedia.caption: William R. Harris in an undated photo. A lawyer and analyst for the RAND Corporation, he worked on grand strategies to prevent war and catastrophe.
multimedia.copyright: Jim Barbere Photography, via Christine Johnston

results.title: Experts Urge Strict Workplace Air Quality Standards, in Wake of Pandemic
results.abstract: The researchers issued a call to action to improve indoor air quality as a safeguard against the spread of contagions like the coronavirus.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: A volunteer installed an ultraviolet light-emitting device in the Saint Panteleimon Orthodox Church in Bucharest, Romania. Adding UV lights, filters to existing ventilation and even just opening windows can improve air quality, the authors of a new study said.

results.title: Spencer Silver, an Inventor of Post-it Notes, Is Dead at 80
results.abstract: He created the adhesive that lets the small, square notes stick to surfaces. They became one of the most ubiquitous office products ever conceived.

multimedia.caption: Spencer Silver, left, was a chemist at 3M when he created the adhesive that lets Post-it Notes adhere to surfaces as easily as they’re peeled off. His 3M colleague Art Fry, right, figured how to use it to create what is now one of the most ubiquitous office products.

Spencer Silver, left, was a chemist at 3M when he created the adhesive that lets Post-it Notes adhere to surfaces as easily as they’re peeled off. His 3M colleague Art Fry, right, figured how to use it to create what is now one of the most ubiquitous office products.

Spencer Silver, left, was a chemist at 3M when he created the adhesive that lets Post-it Notes adhere to surfaces as easily as they’re peeled off. His 3M colleague Art Fry, right, figured how to use it to create what is now one of the most ubiquitous office products.

results.title: Coronavirus Vaccines Protect Pregnant Women, Another Study Suggests
results.abstract: The shots may also have benefits for infants and do not seem to damage the placenta, according to the latest research.

multimedia.caption: Research has shown that pregnant women with Covid symptoms are more likely to be admitted to the I.C.U., require mechanical ventilation and die from the virus than non-pregnant women.

results.title: Remains Found 36 Years Ago in Montana Are Identified
results.abstract: DNA analysis has identified the remains of a woman, who for decades was known only as Christy Crystal Creek, as those of Janet Lee Lucas, who was last seen in Spokane, Wash., in 1983.

multimedia.caption: Janet Lee Lucas in an undated family photo. A genetic profile extracted from a molar led investigators to identify remains that were found in 1985 as those of Ms. Lucas, who vanished in 1983.

results.title: Should We Stash Our Masks for Cold and Flu Season?

results.title: One of the World’s Longest-Running Experiments Sends Up Sprouts
results.abstract: After lying dormant in buried bottles for 142 years, 11 seeds germinated on the Michigan State University campus after scientists planted them.

results.title: Can You Have More Than 150 Friends?
results.abstract: A new study questions that figure, known as Dunbar’s number. The Oxford professor for whom it is named, Robin Dunbar, dismissed the findings as “absolutely bonkers.”
